item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Where do I get my ideas from? You might as well have asked that of Beethoven. He was goofing around in Germany like everybody else, and all of a sudden this stuff came gushing out of him. It was music. I was goofing around like everybody else in Indiana, and all of a sudden stuff came gushing out. It was disgust with civilization." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut, Jr
item.description: "Dear future generations: Please accept our apologies. We were rolling drunk on petroleum." -- Kurt Vonnegut, Jr

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All this happened, more or less." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Clint Eastwood
item.description: "I have a very strict gun control policy: if there's a gun around, I want to be in control of it." -- Clint Eastwood

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Remorse.-- Never yield to remorse, but at once tell yourself: remorse would simply mean adding to the first act of stupidity a second." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Faith: not wanting to know what the truth is." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There is not enough love and goodness in the world to permit giving any of it away to imaginary beings." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Is life not a thousand times too short for us to bore ourselves?" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Life's splendor forever lies in wait about each one of us in all its fullness, but veiled from view, deep down, invisible, far off. It is there, though, not hostile, not reluctant, not deaf. If you summon it by the right word, by its right name, it will come." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Freedom is what we do with what is done to us." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Life has no meaning a prioriâ€¦ It is up to you to give it a meaning, and value is nothing but the meaning that you choose." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"To be is to do - Socrates
To do is to be - Sartre
Do Be Do Be Do - Sinatra" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "He who controls the past controls the future. He who controls the present controls the past." -- George Orwell

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The greatest enemy of clear language is insincerity." -- George Orwell

item.title: Koroviev add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Journalism is printing what someone else does not want printed: everything else is public relations." -- George Orwell
